key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA prices for Kenya Airways are usually higher than the airline's website, dominating over 91% of cases.
The MSE channel offers significant competitive pricing, with a notable portion of fares lower than the airline's website prices.
Kenya Airways' GDS fares are consistently higher than those on the website, with premiums evident in over 95% of instances.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: For Kenya Airways, OTA-listed prices are higher than their website over 91% of the time across different dimensions.
Instances where OTAs offered lower prices than the airline's site were rare, at just over 1%.
Instances of prices being the same on both OTA and the airline's website remained low, with no significant weekly or monthly trends.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Price comparisons not found on the OTA decreased slightly by around 3% compared to the previous week and month.
OTAs frequently list higher prices, though the frequency decreased by approximately 3%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul itineraries show a consistent trend with OTA prices higher than the website in over 91% of cases.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Flights originating from Kenya follow the overall trends, with OTA prices predominately higher and few price parity instances.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Far out bookings consistently show OTA prices higher, with no reduction over time.
Closer to departure, OTA prices remain higher, but there's variability with slight decreases noticed in recent comparisons.

mse_highlights.line_content: A significant portion of fares on the MSE channel are lower than those found directly on the airline's website, highlighting competitive pricing.
The proportion of rates that are the same on MSE and the airline's site is relatively stable, indicating consistent pricing strategies.
Occasional instances where MSE fares are higher than the website indicate opportunities for alignment.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: On average, 72% of prices remain consistent between the MSE channel and the airline's site, showing stable across all periods.
Approximately 28% of fares are lower on MSE on a week-over-week basis, suggesting MSE's competitive pricing approach.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: For Short Haul flights, MSE is more likely to offer lower prices, reinforcing their competitive edge in this segment.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: The Kenyan point of origin shows higher competitive pricing activity, with 28% of fares lower on MSE.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: MSE fares are more competitive (21% lower) in the close-in window, emphasizing aggressive pricing strategies for last-minute bookings.
Far out bookings have a 38% lower price on MSE with consistency, indicating a strategic advantage in early bookings.

gds_highlights.line_content: Kenya Airways' GDS prices are frequently higher than its website, reflecting a persistent premium in GDS offers.
Over 95% of itineraries analyzed show a higher price in the GDS channel compared to the website for consecutive months.
Price differentials between GDS and website are stable, with only minor fluctuations observed over time.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The frequency of GDS prices being unlisted on the website remains constant, indicating no significant improvement in aligning web and GDS visibility.
Consistently, nearly 96% of all cases reflect higher GDS pricing over the website, showing unchanged strategies in the channel.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes continue to exhibit a high prevalence of GDS channel price premiums, with over 95% priced higher than the corresponding website rates.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Fares originating in Kenya mirror the general trend, with the majority priced higher in the GDS channel.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings reveal slight variations in the GDS pricing trend, with minor reductions in frequency compared to further booking windows, yet GDS remains mostly higher.
Far-out bookings are predominantly priced higher in the GDS channel, reflecting a locked-in higher pricing strategy similar to close-in trends.
